definition: "hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to inform/to report/to make known/report/speech/talk/lecture/CL:篇[pian1],份[fen4],個|个[ge4],通[tong4]
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
morning newspaper/(in a newspaper's name) Morning Post
to report (malefactors to the police)/to denounce
to report (to the authorities)/to declare (to customs)
to sound an alarm/to report sth to the police
to report/to give an account of/report
to report/to give an account of/to collect information and report back

sentences.english: Packets in the IP layer are called datagrams.
sentences.chinese: IP层中的数据包称为“数据报”。

sentences.english: She cleverly got rid of the rogues who followed her, and called the police.
sentences.chinese: 甩脱了尾随她的小流氓，然后报了警。

sentences.english: You should send a message to your family, maybe they are looking forward to it!
sentences.chinese: 给您的家人报一声平安，或许他们正在翘首企盼。

sentences.english: I want to enroll in a driving school. Do you have any advice?
sentences.chinese: 我想报驾校。你能给我点儿建议吗？

sentences.english: He time and newspapers every day.
sentences.chinese: 他每天花更多的时间看书报。

sentences.english: People believe that good is rewarded with good.
sentences.chinese: 因为在老百姓心里，好人必有好报。

sentences.english: Particularly in the News of the World, this was a newsroom out of control.
sentences.chinese: 尤其是《世界新闻报》，那里的新闻编辑室已经失控。

sentences.english: In the past two years, I have been an editor for the English Paper of my department.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的两年里我一直担任本系英语报的一名编辑。

sentences.english: The revenger of blood himself shall slay the murderer: when he meeteth him, he shall slay him.
sentences.chinese: 报血仇的必亲自杀那故杀人的，一遇见就杀他。

sentences.english: Shanghai i Securities News reported, to combat escaped and revoked debts has become an important task for the current banking industry.
sentences.chinese: 上证报消息，打击逃废债已成当前银行业的重要任务。

sentences.english: As this newspaper has repeatedly argued.
He is not purely good because he wants revenge for the death of his parents.
sentences.chinese: 他不全然是个好人，因为他想报弑亲之仇。

sentences.english: Bail was set at $50, 000, according to the Orange County Business Journal.
sentences.chinese: 据《橘子郡商业报》报道，保释金为五万美元。

sentences.english: Xinmin Bao was one of the largest folk newspapers in China before 1949.
sentences.chinese: 《新民报》是解放前中国最大的民间报系之一。

sentences.english: 4，We're willing to make you a firm offer at this price.
sentences.chinese: 我们愿意以此价格为你报实盘。

sentences.english: The left-leaning La Repubblica said it was a "reckless comment."
sentences.chinese: 左翼的《共和报》称这是“鲁莽的言论”。

definition: to receive mail/to receive a telegraph
to fall/to tumble/to trip/(of prices etc) to drop/Taiwan pr. [die2]
(of a publisher) to send a manuscript off to the printer/(of a journalist) to send a dispatch
to receive/to accept/to collect/to put away/to restrain/to stop/in care of (used on address line after name)
to sign up/to enter one's name/to apply/to register/to enroll/to enlist
to close/to stop/to put a stop to sth/cut-off point/stopping point/deadline
to report to one's superiors/to appear in the news/to reply to a letter
